New Records: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning of the first game of the World Series, securing the Dodgers victory over the Yankees
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton's go-ahead, two-run home run in the sixth inning
Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s go-ahead run in the top of the 10th inning
Tommy Edman's diving stop on Austin Wells' single in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge was expected to bounce back in Game 2 after a 1-for-5 performance in Game 1
Mookie Betts was hitless in Game 1 but had a walk and a sacrifice fly
Freddie Freeman was playing on a bum ankle but showed signs of improvement, including a first-inning triple
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed disappointment but vowed to move forward and learn from the loss
Mookie Betts was glad that Freddie Freeman hit the walk-off grand slam
Freddie Freeman's moment was a testament to his resilience and determination
Nestor Cortes took responsibility for his mistake and expressed confidence in his ability to bounce back
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a classic matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees, with both teams showing resilience and determination
The walk-off grand slam was a moment reminiscent of Kirk Gibson's iconic home run in the 1988 World Series
The game was a testament to the importance of clutch performances and making the most of opportunities
Others: The Dodgers' victory marked a significant moment in the World Series, with the team taking a 1-0 lead
